clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Insomnia (CBT-I) on Glycemic Control in Older Type 2 Diabetes (T2D) Comorbid With Insomnia
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Insomnia (CBT-I) on Glycemic Control in Older Type 2 Diabetes (T2D) Comorbid With Insomnia

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a RCT aiming to use CBT-I as intervention, compared to usual care as control, to elucidate the effect of CBT-I on glycemic control, sleep quality, psychological outcomes, and cognitive function in Hong Kong Chinese older T2D comorbid with insomnia.

primary_outcome.measure: The primary outcome measure will be changes in glycemic control, as measured by HbA1c, from baseline.

intervention.description: CBT is a first line therapy for insomnia
